meanings.definition: A person who held a job or office before the current holder.
meanings.sent1: My predecessors at the company left behind a legacy of hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent2: The new manager decided to follow the successful strategies of her predecessors.
meanings.sent3: It's like a relay race where my predecessors passed the baton of responsibility to me.
meanings.sent4: The footsteps of my predecessors paved the way for my own journey in this role.
meanings.sent5: The wisdom of my predecessors continues to guide me in my daily tasks.

meanings.definition: Something that comes before something else in time or in a series.
meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins are the predecessors of the modern city that stands there now.
meanings.sent2: The prototype was the predecessor of the final product we see today.
meanings.sent3: The first chapter of the book serves as a predecessor to the exciting events that follow.
meanings.sent4: The early sketches were the predecessors to the masterpiece painting.
meanings.sent5: The initial idea was the predecessor to the innovative solution that was eventually implemented.
